correction_response: This tweet is partially misinformed. Elon Musk did indeed express willingness to donate $6 billion to end world hunger if the UN could provide a detailed plan, but there's no evidence that the UN has provided such a plan yet [source](https://theconversation.com/should-elon-musk-try-to-solve-the-problem-of-world-hunger-with-6-billion-5-questions-answered-171187). As for the Twitter acquisition, Musk did not use the $6 billion he proposed for world hunger to buy Twitter. The $44 billion acquisition was financed through a combination of equity and debt financing, with major banks committing to provide $13 billion [source](https://www.reuters.com/markets/us/who-is-financing-elon-musks-44-billion-deal-buy-twitter-2022-10-07/).
note_1_text: Musk did sell Tesla stock for $5.7b and donated it to charity, weeks after the UN World Food Program determined $6b would not solve world hunger.  The director of the World Food Program walked back many of his statements about how useful the money would be.    https://fortune.com/2022/02/15/elon-musk-5-7-billion-donation-weeks-after-asking-un-world-hunger/    https://www.snopes.com/news/2022/04/26/elon-musk-hunger/
note_2_text: The $6 billion figure is $3.6 Billion less than the World Food Programme actually spent in 2021 on World Hunger, & that is a yearly figure. "WFP is funded entirely by voluntary donations, with a record US$9.6 billion raised in 2021"  So $6 billion would not solve world hunger. https://www.wfp.org/stories/wfp-glance#:~:text=US%242.3%20billion%20was%20provided,cash%20or%20vouchers%20in%202021.
